title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 211.13 - Ring costumes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 211.13 - Ring costumes

State Regulations

Each participant shall provide him or herself with the ring
costume prescribed or approved by the Commission, and for males such costume
shall include a foul-proof guard of the boxer's own selection, type to be
approved by the Commission, adequate as determined by the Commission in its
discretion to satisfactorily reduce the risks of the boxer being disabled by a
low blow or blows received during the contest. Each participant shall provide
him or herself with two mouthpieces of a type approved by the Commission, and
shall wear one of such mouthpieces while participating in a contest or
exhibition. No shoes with spikes, cleats, hard soles or hard heels shall be
worn in the ring. Notes

York State Register September 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 38, eff. 9/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
